description: "Russia remains the most active foreign threat to our elections," said Director of National Intelligence Avril Haines, noting that new AI technologies make influence operations easier to pull off.
title: U.S. elections face more threats from foreign actors and artificial intelligence

description: A federal district court ruled that the new map drawn by the state legislature violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting the Black vote. A group of conservatives challenged the legislature's map.
title: Supreme Court upholds Louisiana redistricting plan

description: People in the French Pacific territory of New Caledonia are protesting a reform that would give voting rights to an increasing number of non-Indigenous residents of the archipelago.
title: France imposes a state of emergency in New Caledonia as unrest continues

description:
A conservative group posted a social media thread showing flyers in a border encampment in Mexico urging migrants to vote for Joe Biden. Now, the woman caught up in it, speaks to NPR.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: How a migrant aid group got caught up in a right-wing social media thread

description: Report from the Pew Research Center says Hispanic women in general continue to face pressure to play traditional roles, despite advances in educational attainment and entrepreneurship
title: Latinas are succeeding, but feel pressured to playing traditional roles for women

description: China, the country that once feared overpopulation, is now experiencing a falling birthrate. The government is encouraging  its citizens to have children. We visit a "marriage market" where hopeful young people are looking for a match.
title: A Visit to a "Marriage Market" in China

description: The Economist Middle East correspondent Gregg Carlstrom explains why some Arab leaders hate Hamas, fear Iran and have some sympathy for Israel — although not for how Israel is waging the war.
title: Gaza will be 'one big displacement camp' for the foreseeable future, journalist says

description: Inflation eased a bit last month, according to a report Wednesday from the Labor Department. Consumer prices in April were up 3.4% from a year ago — a smaller annual increase than the month before.
title: Eggs, milk and other grocery prices fall, as overall inflation eases

description: The actor was granted bail when he appeared in a London court to face five charges of offenses against three men.
title: His lawyer says Kevin Spacey strenuously denies sex charges

description: Here's a closer look at the United Nations' breakdown of casualties. The overall total of more than 35,000 Palestinians killed since Oct. 7, based on Gaza Health Ministry figures, has not declined.
title: Why the U.N. revised the numbers of women and children killed in Gaza

description: Scientists are looking at the ways humans change the planet-- and the impact that has on the spread of infectious disease. You might be surprised at some of their conclusions.
title: What's worse for disease spread: animal loss, climate change or urbanization?

description: Powerful synthetic opioids and drugs like meth and cocaine still flood U.S. communities, fueling historically high overdose deaths.
title: U.S. drug deaths declined slightly in 2023 but remained at crisis levels

description: President Biden's team says he won't be part of the Commission on Presidential Debates plan. But he said he would be open to two televised debates, in June and September.
title: Biden proposes debates in June and September, and names terms. Trump says yes

description: Nearly 1 in 5 Americans have maxed out their credit card borrowing, according to the Federal Reserve Bank in New York. Tiny Desk Contest crowns its 10th anniversary winner.
title: Americans are struggling to pay off credit card debt; Tiny Desk Contest's 2024 winner

description: Both of these novels, Pages of Mourning and The Cemetery of Untold Stories, from an emerging writer and a long-celebrated one, respectively, walk an open road of remembering love, grief, and fate.
title: Two new novels investigate what makes magic, what is real and imagined

description: Since last October, complaints have included Israeli soldiers firing on unarmed Palestinian refugees and the killing of World Central Kitchen aid workers when Israeli drones fired on their convoy.
title: How Israel's military investigates itself in cases of possible wrongdoing

description: In a statement to NPR, a spokesperson for the retail giant says it is committed to supporting the LGBTQ+ community year-round, not only during the month of June.
title: Target scales back on its LGBTQ+ merchandise ahead of Pride Month 2024

description: For Noem, "every state is now a border state" including her own where she says some tribal leaders are benefiting from drug cartel activity.
title: Most of South Dakota's tribes have banned Kristi Noem from their land. Here's why

description: There have been no reports of negative reactions as a result of the recall, the FDA said last week. The products should be thrown away, or returned to either an Aldi or HyVee store for a full refund.
title: Aldi and Hy-Vee stores recall cream cheese varieties for possible salmonella risk

description: When Amylyx Pharmaceuticals found out its ALS drug Relyvrio didn't work, the company took the unusual step of voluntarily pulling it off the market.
title: Lots of drug companies talk about putting patients first — but this one actually did

description: Planes make diversions — also called "emergency landings" — all the time. Almost always, everyone on board is fine. Here are some reasons why.
title: There's usually no need to panic when planes make emergency landings. Here's why

description: A special education staffing crisis is raging through many U.S. school districts. It's taking a toll on students and families.
title: Why children with disabilities are missing school and losing skills

description: As protests continue to rock the campuses of colleges and universities, a familiar set of questions is being raised: Are these protests really being led by students? Or are the real drivers of the civil disobedience outsiders, seizing on an opportunity to wreak chaos and stir up trouble?
title: Why the trope of the 'outside agitator' persists

description: Netiporn Sanesangkhom, 28, was a member of the activist group Thaluwang, known demanding reform of the monarchy and abolition of the law that makes it illegal to defame members of the royal family.
title: A monarchy reform activist in Thailand dies in detention after a hunger strike

description: Walmart said it will require most remote workers in its Dallas, Atlanta and Toronto offices to relocate to its offices in Bentonville, Arkansas; Hoboken, New Jersey; and the San Francisco Bay Area.
title: Walmart lays off hundreds of employees and requires others to relocate

description: The former two-term governor's win in Tuesday's primary gives Republicans a chance at a Senate seat in deep blue state. Hogan will face Democrat and Prince George's County Executive Angela Alsobrooks.
title: Maryland Democrats pick Angela Alsobrooks to take on Hogan for open U.S. Senate seat

description: Boeing has violated the terms of a deal to avoid prosecution after the fatal crashes of two 737 Max planes more than five years ago, the Department of Justice told a federal judge on Tuesday.
title: DOJ says Boeing broke deal that avoided prosecution after 2 fatal 737 Max crashes
